page.title: 17Unemployment - Yardley
page.content: One of the people questioned who was unemployed had been so for 11 months and found it degrading. She was trained as a secretary/receptionist but had not retrained since being made redundant. Another person had been redundant for 4 years and was a trained maintenance fitter. He had applied for numerous jobs, had 9 interviews but was not willing to take just any job to be employed. They both believe Youth Training Schemes are useful, but only if they are used to train young people for worthwhile jobs, and are not used as cheap labour for employers. It was felt that Social Service help could be improved, being given to areas of real need and not being spent on local and central government.
